statements: SELECT * FROM error_logs
SELECT id, error_code FROM error_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT description FROM error_logs WHERE error_code = '404'
SELECT * FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp > '2022-01-01'
SELECT id, timestamp FROM error_logs WHERE description LIKE '%database%'
SELECT * FROM error_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT id, description FROM error_logs WHERE error_code = '404'
SELECT * FROM error_logs WHERE description ILIKE '%error%'
SELECT id, timestamp FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM error_logs
SELECT * FROM error_logs;
SELECT id, error_message FROM error_logs;
SELECT timestamp, error_message FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM error_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT id, timestamp FROM error_logs WHERE error_message LIKE '%error%';
SELECT id, timestamp, error_message FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT * FROM error_logs WHERE error_message LIKE '%error%' AND timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30' ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT id, timestamp, error_message FROM error_logs WHERE error_message ILIKE '%warning%' ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT DISTINCT timestamp::date, COUNT(*) as error_count FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' GROUP BY timestamp::date ORDER BY error_count DESC
SELECT id, timestamp, error_message FROM error_logs WHERE timestamp >= current_date - interval '1 week' ORDER BY timestamp ASC LIMIT 3
SELECT * FROM error_logs;
SELECT robot_id, log_message FROM error_logs WHERE id < 10;
SELECT robot_name, serial_number FROM robots;
SELECT * FROM troubleshooting_records WHERE technician_id = 1234;
SELECT robot_id, robot_name FROM robots ORDER BY manufacturing_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM error_logs WHERE robot_id = 4 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT robot_name, serial_number, manufacturing_date FROM robots WHERE last_maintenance < '2021-06-01';
SELECT technician_id, COUNT(record_id) AS num_records FROM troubleshooting_records GROUP BY technician_id HAVING num_records > 3;
SELECT error_logs.log_message, troubleshooting_records.solution FROM error_logs JOIN troubleshooting_records ON error_logs.id = troubleshooting_records.error_id WHERE technician_id = 8;
SELECT robot_name, model, last_maintenance FROM robots WHERE model LIKE '%XS' ORDER BY last_maintenance ASC;
SELECT * FROM robots;
SELECT robot_name, robot_type, robot_status FROM robots ORDER BY robot_name ASC;
SELECT system_name, system_description FROM robot_systems WHERE robot_id = 2;
SELECT error_description, error_timestamp FROM error_logs WHERE error_id = 10;
SELECT record_details, record_date FROM troubleshooting_records ORDER BY record_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM error_logs WHERE error_timestamp > '2022-01-01';
SELECT error_description, error_timestamp FROM error_logs ORDER BY error_timestamp DESC;
SELECT robot_name, robot_type FROM robots WHERE robot_status = 'Active';
SELECT r.robot_name, rs.system_name FROM robots r JOIN robot_systems rs ON r.robot_id = rs.robot_id;
SELECT tr.record_details, e.error_description FROM troubleshooting_records tr JOIN error_logs e ON tr.error_id = e.error_id;
SELECT * FROM robot_errors;
SELECT error_message, severity FROM robot_errors WHERE severity = 'High';
SELECT id, error_type, error_timestamp FROM robot_errors ORDER BY error_timestamp DESC;
SELECT id, description, steps_taken FROM robot_troubleshooting LIMIT 5;
SELECT robot_id, system_status FROM robot_status WHERE system_status = 'Running';
SELECT * FROM robot_errors WHERE error_type = 'hardware' LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, error_message, error_timestamp FROM robot_errors WHERE severity = 'critical';
SELECT robot_id, error_count FROM robot_status WHERE system_status = 'operational' ORDER BY error_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM robot_troubleshooting WHERE steps_taken LIKE '%reboot%' AND status = 'resolved';
SELECT robot_id, hardware_info FROM robot_system_info WHERE software_info LIKE '%version 2%' ORDER BY robot_id ASC;
